channel.title: Help on log in screen
channel.description: How do i change the picture in the log in screen i made a url and all that nowq where in my client filesdo i go to paste the url?

item.title: Help on log in screen
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

[quote=“iz3 legend, post:9, topic:401077”][quote author=Anc13ntsIsBack link=topic=498134.msg3642766#msg3642766 date=1309137189]

be more nice i dont need a noobs help gtfo nerd.ill get a pro not a retard

I’m not going to be nice if you’re not going to put anything in to detail. Now you’re calling me a retard when you failed at typing one little sentence?

If you think someone is a retard, take a quick glance in the mirror or turn on your webcam if you have on. You’ll see a true kid who has the mental capacity of a 12 year old. Then again, you might be 12.
[/quote]

Ancients get outa here… If you where some super coder you would have atleast been able to some what interpret what he was saying. Then again, you might be 12.[/quote]
Coding? You mean Java. Java has nothing to do with grammar.

How do i change the picture in the log in screen i made a url and all that nowq where in my client filesdo i go to paste the url?

How can I interpret this? He can be talking about the Login Screen Interface (The one that comes up like in real runescape upon loggging in), Buttons, Background? People from moparscape, like you think they know Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Help on log in screen
item.dc:creator: @tchandle tchandle
item.description:
@tchandle wrote:

iz3 legend:

well… to change the background of the client check sprites or cache and find the current image and replace it. If you cant find it use a cache editor to change it (search a tutorial). I dont see what a url has to do with client background but if your trying to change where the links take you in a “file” menu, go to jframe or client.java and search the current adress and replace it. When changing the client background you do not need to comple, but when changing urls in the menu you need to compile.

This…

Also to add on just something something small incase your totally lost. You find client image…

Client Folder -> cache -> sprites -> background.(png/jpg/gif/etc…)

If background image is not there. You will have to use a cache editor like legend said.

Read full topic

I dont see what a url has to do with client background but if your trying to change where the links take you in a “file” menu, go to jframe or client.java and search the current adress and replace it. When changing the client background you do not need to comple, but when changing urls in the menu you need to compile.
